Tucker Civic Center at FSU Comment Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at FSU The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at Florida State University is North Florida’s Premiere Entertainment & Convention Center featuring a 12,500 seat arena, Luxury Suites and Club Seats and over 54,000 sq. ft. of meeting and exhibition space plus an arena view restaurant, Spotlight Grille. The Tucker Center hosts a wide variety of concerts, family shows, Broadway shows, and sporting events including FSU Basketball. The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at Florida State University is North Florida’s Premiere Entertainment & Convention Center featuring a 12,500 seat arena, Luxury Suites and Club Seats and over 54,000 sq. ft. of meeting and exhibition space plus an arena view restaurant, Spotlight Grille. The Tucker Center hosts a wide variety of concerts, family shows, Broadway shows, and sporting events including FSU Basketball. View less MORE ABOUT THIS VENUE Venue Type: Arena/Stadium ; Community Center ; Concert Hall ; Performing Arts Center ; Restaurant/Cafe ; Theater LOCATION Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at FSU 505 West Pensacola Street, Tallahassee, FL 32301 View in Google Maps MAKE IT A NIGHT View map Don’t see your business listed here? Email us to add it! Expand [+] ALBUQUERQUE LITTLE THEATRE FOOD Cheese Coffee Caf Downtown Liu Chinese Fast Food Vinaigrette Garcias Kitchen The Original Route 66 Malt Shop Bottger Mansion of Old Town Accommodation Bottger Mansion of Old Town Liu Chinese Fast Food Drink Bottger Mansion of Old Town Liu Chinese Vinaigrette Accessibility Information Braille Info Wheelchair Access PARKING INFO Parking in available in our main lot located off of Pensacola St. And also the surrounding garages. Disabled parking is located in all lots surrounding the arena. A disabled parking permit is required for admittance into the disabled parking areas. The location for accessible parking and transportation is located at the Copeland Street Parking Garage. The entrance into the Garage will be from South Copeland Street, with the exception of Accessible Vans using the St. Augustine Street entrance. The Dial-A-Ride Bus Line will pick-up at the bus loading zone on South Copeland Street beginning two hours prior to kick-off. All patron vehicular traffic must flow from Pensacola Street to South Copeland Street for entry. Dial-A-Ride Tickets are $5.00 each, cash only and available at pick-up location. PUBLIC HOURS 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. for the administration office and 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. for the box office. PUBLIC ADMISSION FEES Ticket prices depend on the event. Wheelchair Access OUR PARTNERS COCA's programs are sponsored in part by the City of Tallahassee, Leon County, the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, Community Foundation of North Florida, Knight Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, and the Tallahassee Community Redevelopment Agency. COCA, the Council on Culture & Arts, is a non-profit organization that serves as the facilitator and voice for the arts and cultural industry in Florida's capital area. COCA provides information and promotes the arts and culture to both citizens and visitors. ABOUT US DIRECTORIES CLASSIFIEDS PARTNERS CONTACT US 114 S DUVAL STREET TALLAHASSEE, FL 32301 LOCAL NUMBER: (850) 224-2500 EMAIL: info@tallahasseearts.org © Copyright 2025 - Council on Culture & Arts | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Powered by ARTSOPOLIS The COCA office currently has adjusted office hours to 1 PM – 5 PM to accommodate pickup for Winterfest. These hours will be adjusted from Tuesday, February 11, through Friday, February 28 . Regular office hours will return on Monday, March 3. For questions, feel free to contact staff via phone or email. In addition, access to Railroad Avenue between Gaines Street & FAMU Way is down to one lane heading south. For access to the COCA office, please take Gaines Street as currently, the COCA office is not accessible off of FAMU Way.

Pensacola St. Tallahassee, FL 32301 Mailing Address: 505 West Pensacola Street Tallahassee, FL 32301 Administration/General Inquires – 850-644-SHOW (7469) Box Office – 850-645-0747 Employee Directory Administration Ron Rideout - General Manager R yan Zornes - Assistant General Manager Sales & Marketing H annah Pierce - Director of Marketing Christian Suero - Director of Sales Jimmie Holloway III - Group Sales & Premium Services Manager L ucy Mann - Conference & Banquet Sales Manager Zahria Harvey - Marketing Coordinator Operations Ethan Burch - Director of Operations Ron Cull - Building Services Manager David Slomski - Operations Manager Dauntey Watson - Operations Supervisor Mike Monahan -Lead Maintenance Technician James Nuelle - Maintenance Technician Food & Beverage Alan Davis - Director of Food & Beverage Robert Binder - Executive Head Chef Anthony Green - Executive Sous Chef/Spotlight Grille Chef Parris Davis - Food & Beverage Office Manager George Limage - Concessions Manager Kiley Talbert - Catering and Suites Manager Events Martin De Jesus - Director of Events Ryan Fink - Event Manager Justin Bostock - Event Manager Justin Kaye - Building Security Supervisor Finance Angi e Seib - Director of Finance Errin Klein - Accounting Manager R ene Sheffield - Accounting Coordinator Box Office Dominic Dicesare - Box Office Manager For Questions, Concerns, or Comments please fill out the below form: Fill out my online form . About Oak View Group (OVG) Oak View Group (OVG) is the global leader in live experience venue development, management, premium hospitality services, and 360-degree solutions for a collection of world-class owned venues and a client roster of arenas, convention centers, music festivals, performing arts centers, and cultural institutions. Founded by Tim Leiweke and Irving Azoff in 2015, OVG is the leading developer of major new venues either open or under development across four continents. Employment | Donald L Tucker Civic Center Twitter Facebook Instagram Contact Us Donald L Tucker Civic Center Search Home Events & Tickets FSU Basketball Calendar of Events Groups & Special Offers Suite Rentals Box Office Buy Tickets Now Access Your Ticketing Account All Access Club Signup Plan Your Visit Around Tallahassee Preferred Hotels Area Restaurants About Tallahassee Directions & Parking Bag Policy Spotlight Grille Tucker Center Spotlight on Anthony Green Center Concessions Accessibility Fan Guide A-Z Tucker Center Seminole SportShop Local Senior Discounts Premium Seating Center Suites Order Food & Beverage Club Seats Book Your Event Banquets & Receptions Meetings & Conferences Trade Shows & Expos Arena Promoter Information Merchandising Center Catering Contact Form Arena Info About Us Employment Contact Us Latest News and Updates Advertising & Sponsorship Our Partners Connect With Us OVG Supplier Diversity Program Employment Oak View Group (OVG) is the global leader in live experience venue development, management, premium hospitality services, and 360-degree solutions for a collection of world-class owned venues and a client roster of arenas, convention centers, music festivals, performing arts centers, and cultural institutions. Founded by Tim Leiweke and Irving Azoff in 2015, OVG is the leading developer of major new venues either open or under development across four continents. Full Time Opportunities Building Services Supervisor Building Services Supervisor is responsible for ensuring standards of cleaning are met, performing custodial quality checks, training new employees on proper custodial procedures, and general maintenance of facilities. Click here for full description/ to apply Part Time Opportunities Part time positions include event staff/ushers, box office ticket sellers, housekeeping, parking attendants, changeover crew, and stagehands. Applications can be picked up at the Box Office M-F from 10 AM - 5 PM. Food & Beverage Positions Dishwasher The Dishwasher washes and sanitizes all tableware, serving materials, cooking equipment and small wares. The employee must maintain excellent attendance and be available to work events as scheduled per business need. Click here for full description/ to apply Banquet Server Managed by OVG, the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center purpose is to create, plan and execute outstanding event experiences. To achieve this, our employees must provide the highest levels of guest service by demonstrating our principles of being professional, resourceful, accommodating and precise, while always being safe. To be successful in this role, candidates must be friendly and honest, build strong relationships, continually strive to provide a seamless experience, and be flexible to our guests needs by providing quality services and products through detailed and accurate communication. Team members of the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center must share in our values of being adaptable to event needs, being aware of guest requirements, showing strong character, and being team centric. Click here for full description/ to apply Warehouse Supervisor The Warehouse Supervisor is responsible for the effective management and running of venue distribution/warehouse operations including inventory, receiving, purchasing, ordering, lay-ins, purchase order tracking, clean-up, transfers and equipment maintenance. The Warehouse Supervisor will actively supervise, coach, counsel, direct, train and mentor employees in meeting company quality standards. This is a key position for the effective and profitable operation of the business. The employee must maintain excellent attendance and be available to work a variable event-driven schedule which includes evenings and weekends.  Open availability, professional presentation, outstanding interpersonal skills, self-direction and strong management and independent decision-making skills are required. Click here for full description/ to apply Event Department Postions Overnight Building Security This position is committed to providing World Class Service for all Donald L. Tucker Civic Center arena events.  The Overnight Building Security position is responsible for ensuring the safety and security for all events.  Special security assignments may be available during non-event days/nights.  The security team is a provider of direct service to our guests and must exhibit a professional and courteous demeanor at all times. Click here for full description/ to apply Parking Lot Attendant This position is committed to providing World Class Service for all Donald L. Tucker Civic Center Parking Lots for all events and is responsible for the protection, outdoor protection and safeguarding of Guests and Employees and their vehicles. This position is committed to providing a positive first impression with World Class Service. The position requires physical activity including standing, walking, and climbing stairs. Click here for full description/ to apply Guest Services Staff As a member of the Guest Services Team, you will be an essential part of the Guest experience and help build memories that last a lifetime. In this role, you will wear many different hats and have the potential to work in several different areas of the arena. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, ushering, ticket scanning, concourse customer service, greeter and attending to stairs, escalators, and elevators. Click here for full description/ to apply Operations Department Postions Changeover Supervisor Coordinate and supervise conversions Oversee hiring, training, scheduling and managing of changeover staff to accurately and efficiently set up and tear down events Assume management responsibility for all services and activities involved in the operations of arena and exhibit hall large sets Select, train, motivate, and evaluate front-line staff; provide or coordinate staff training; work with employees to correct deficiencies; implement discipline procedures Assist in the planning, direction, coordination, and reviewing work plans for facility operations Click here for full description/ to apply For Stagehand and IATSE opportunities, email Ethan Burch Home Events & Tickets Plan Your Visit Premium Seating Book Your Event Arena Info 505 W Pensacola St Tallahassee, Florida 32301 © 2025			Donald L Tucker Civic Center. | Site Map | Privacy Policy a carbon house experience

Fan Guide A-Z | Donald L Tucker Civic Center Twitter Facebook Instagram Contact Us Donald L Tucker Civic Center Search Home Events & Tickets FSU Basketball Calendar of Events Groups & Special Offers Suite Rentals Box Office Buy Tickets Now Access Your Ticketing Account All Access Club Signup Plan Your Visit Around Tallahassee Preferred Hotels Area Restaurants About Tallahassee Directions & Parking Bag Policy Spotlight Grille Tucker Center Spotlight on Anthony Green Center Concessions Accessibility Fan Guide A-Z Tucker Center Seminole SportShop Local Senior Discounts Premium Seating Center Suites Order Food & Beverage Club Seats Book Your Event Banquets & Receptions Meetings & Conferences Trade Shows & Expos Arena Promoter Information Merchandising Center Catering Contact Form Arena Info About Us Employment Contact Us Latest News and Updates Advertising & Sponsorship Our Partners Connect With Us OVG Supplier Diversity Program Tucker Center A To Z Fan Guide A Accessible Parking Disabled parking is available in all lots surrounding the arena. A disabled parking permit is required for admittance into the disabled parking areas. Accessible Seating Disabled seating is located throughout the arena. ​ Based on the event, there may be seats available on the floor level, main concourse level, or the upper level. Before purchasing tickets, please inform the ticket office of your need to sit in a disabled seat. Address Donald L. Tucker Civic Center 505 W. Pensacola Street Tallahassee, FL 32301 www.tuckerciviccenter.com Airports Tallahassee International Airport 3300 Capital Cir SW Tallahassee, FL 32310 http://www.talgov.com/airport/AirportHome The Tallahassee International Airport is about 7 miles from the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Alcohol Service Management/Policy To purchase alcohol you must be 21 years of age or older and present a valid state-issued Driver’s License. ​ Guests are not permitted to bring in any outside alcoholic beverages, nor are they permitted to leave the building with alcohol purchased inside the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. The Tucker Center reserves the right to deny entry to any guest that appears to be under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol. An intoxicated guest may also be ejected from the venue if they are showing signs of impairment. Assisted Walkers A guest with an assisted walker may fold it up and store it by their seat as long as it does not block the aisles. If it does not fold up easily and can be placed under your seat, please take it to guest services outside section 101 to store for the time of the event. If you need assistance to your seat after that, someone at guest services will radio for assistance. Assistive Listening Devices For guests that need audio assistance, please stop by Patron Services located on the West Concourse behind Section 101 to receive a device. ​ You will need to provide a valid photo ID which will be kept by our staff until the device is returned at the end of the event. B Backstage Passes Backstage passes are not available for purchase. Bag Searches All bags that are permitted inside the arena will be subject to a search by our Security team. ​ Guests with prohibited items will be asked to return them to their vehicle prior to entering the arena. Banners and Signs Signs are allowed, however, the sign must not be offensive in any manner or oversized. ​ The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center reserves the right to deny use of any sign at any time if it negatively impacts the enjoyment of another patron. This policy is subject to change pending tour request. Basketball Game Dates and Times Please refer Seminole Athletics Website for all FSU Athletics Schedules. Binoculars Binoculars are permitted. Bottles and Containers Guests are not permitted to bring outside bottles or containers inside the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Box Office The main box office is located on the Northwest side of the Arena. The box office sells tickets for Tucker Center Events and club seats for FSU Men's Basketball. ​ Hours of operation are Monday through Friday: 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. C Camera Policy Small non-professional cameras are allowed in the building for most events. Professional cameras can be classified as any camera with a detachable lens. Policy is subject to change per tour request. Cancelled/Postponed Events In the rare event that an event must be cancelled or postponed, please visit the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center website at www.tuckerciviccenter.com for the most up-to-date information regarding your tickets. Catering Oak View Group and the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center have recently gone back in-house for all Food & Beverage needs! We are proud to offer a wide selection of breakfast, lunch, dinner and reception options for any size event here at the Tucker Center. The Spectra team has been hard at work changing, updating, and improving everything from popular menu items to the stands they are served in. For questions regarding booking and catering needs, please contact Lucy Mann at (850) 645-0720. Charities The Tucker Center plans at least one (1) charitable event each quarter. Past partnerships include: Canned Food Drive with Second Harvest of the Big Bend, donated items to the Children’s Home Society, provided blankets for the Senior Center, and donated tickets and meet and greets for FSU organizations, the United Way and various other organizations local to Tallahassee. Interested in getting involved? Please email tuckercenter@fsu.edu . Child’s Ticket Policy Children under the age of two (2) years are admitted free of charge for all events as long as they sit on a lap. The age limit is subject to change based on the show promoter’s request. Clear Bag Policy A Clear Bag Policy is in effect for FSU Men’s & Women’s Basketball games at the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Under this policy, each fan is allowed one clear bag (plus clutch or small purse) into FSU home athletic events that conform to the following restrictions: CLEAR plastic, vinyl or PVC that are no larger than 12” x 6” x 12” (readily available one-gallon, clear, re-sealable plastic storage bags meet the policy) If a logo appears on the bag, it cannot be larger than 4.5” x 6.5” Small clutch bags no larger than 4.5” x 6.5”, or approximately the size of a hand, with or without a strap are allowed. Medically necessary items that are too large to fit into a clear bag within allowable dimensions can be brought in only after clearing a screening process. The clear bag policy has been adopted to allow for a safer environment at Florida State home events and in keeping with increased security practices being implemented at venues around the country. Concessions The Tucker Center has an exclusive concessionaire and caterer with sole rights to all food and beverage requirements in the venue. Credit Card Policy The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center accepts Visa, Amex, MasterCard, Discover, Google Pay, Apple Pay, and Samsung Pay at all concession stands and portables. D Directions to Donald L. Tucker Civic Center From I-10 Take Exit 203 and proceed SW on Thomasville Road (319) to South on Monroe Street (US 27).  Proceed south to Tennessee Street (US 90).  Turn right (west) on Tennessee Street.  Left on Bronough.  Right on Pensacola Street.  Tucker Civic Center will be on your left. From Exit 196 on I-10 Proceed south (263 South) on Capital Circle. Turn left on Blountstown Hwy which turns into Pensacola Street. As you near the FSU football stadium, you will turn right on Stadium Drive. Follow Stadium Drive around to your left and then turn right on St. Augustine which turns into Madison. Tucker Civic Center will be on your left. From the South Proceed north on Crawfordville Highway and veer left to Duval; turn left on Pensacola St.  Tucker Civic Center will be on your left. From Perry Proceed north on US 27 (Apalachee Parkway) until it ends at the Capitol Building.  Turn right on Monroe and take first left on Jefferson.  Jefferson turns in to Pensacola.  Tucker Civic Center will be on your left. Distribution of Materials The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center does not allow unauthorized distribution of material. If you have interest in marketing and advertising opportunities contact Sarah Kraynik at Sarah.Kraynik@oakviewgroup.com . Door Opening Times Door opening times may vary depending on the type of event. Please check our website or call for door times. Drop-Off and Pick-Up Points The drop-off and pick-up point for an event at the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center is the North Drive off of Pensacola St. and East Drive off of MLK Boulevard. E Elevator The guest elevators are located at the NW Corner in the Suite entrance, NE Corner and the SE Corner.  Also, the guest elevator to access Level 1 (Expo Hall/Meeting Rooms) is located in the box office lobby. Emergency Evacuation In the event of an emergency, the Tucker Center staff will provide instructions and direct guests to the nearest emergency exit. Please follow the instructions of the staff and proceed in a calm and safe manner. Exclusive Opportunities Sign up for our All Access Club to receive EXCLUSIVE information regarding upcoming events held at the Tucker Center, including “first to know” event announcements, exclusive pre-sales opportunities, and special offers. F Fan Comments Please feel free to send an email to TuckerCenter@fsu.edu or fill out a feedback form at Patron Services located behind Section 101 on the main concourse. First Aid In case of an emergency, the Tucker Center has a First Aid room located near the east concourse outside Section 113 and is staffed during events with qualified emergency medical technicians. Food and Beverages Brought to Donald L. Tucker Civic Center Guests may not bring food and/or beverages into the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Guests may dispose of the unauthorized items prior to entering the facility. Guests with specific dietary needs due to medical conditions or religious requirements should contact TuckerCenter@fsu.edu . G General Admission General Admission allows you to sit anywhere within the general admission area on a first come, first served basis. Under no circumstances are you allowed to save seats for guests that are not immediately present. Group Tickets The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center maintains a full-service group sales department that provides personal, one-on-one coordination of event outings for community and corporate groups, sporting events as well as annual touring shows or concerts. Group offers are available on an event-to-event basis. Contact Christian Suero at Chrisitan.Suero@oakviewgroup.com or (850) 645-0808 for more information. Guest Services Guest Services is located on the main concourse behind Section 101. Guest Services Representatives are available to assist you with any needs on event days. Need assistance on game day?  Text TUCKER <SPACE> ISSUE & LOCATION to 850-445-7186.  Standard messaging rates apply. H Hosting an Event To book your event at the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center or inquire about rates and service, email Lucy Mann or call 850-645-0720. I Inclement Weather Policy If a Tucker Center event is postponed or cancelled due to inclement weather, please visit our website or call the ticket office. Interpretive Services If you are in need of interpretive services for an event please contact TuckerCenter@fsu.edu no later than two business days prior to the event. Intoxicated Guests The Tucker Center reserves the right to deny entry to any guest that appears to be under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol. An intoxicated guest may also be ejected from the venue if they are showing signs of impairment. J Job Opportunities All part-time and full-time job opportunities are posted online. https://careers-ovg.icims.com/ K L Lost and Found During an arena event, Lost and Found is located at the Patron Services desk. See any staff member for assistance. After an event, please contact the FSU Police Department at 850-644-1234 for Lost and Found inquiries. Lost or Missing Individual Contact the closest Guest Services Representative or visit the Guest Services Desk outside Section 101. Lost or Stolen Tickets If you lose your tickets, please return to the point of purchase for assistance. M Media Access All media credential requests for arena events should be directed to our Director of Marketing, Sarah Kraynik . In your request, please make sure to list your name, publication, and contact information. Medical Emergencies Emergency Medical Technicians will be present for all events and can assist and treat most medical issues. If there is a need for transport, that will be coordinated by the medical team as well. Merchandise The Team Store, operated by the FSU Bookstore, is located on the NW Concourse for athletics events and commencements. Oak View Group handles merchandise for special events and concerts with locations on the NW Concourse and others as needed. N O Outside Vending The selling or sampling of merchandise, food, beverage, tickets or other items on the property without written authorization by Donald L. Tucker Civic Center management is strictly prohibited. Oversized Vehicles Parking Oversized vehicle parking varies per show. Please contact D avid Lewis for more information. Oak View Group (OVG) Oak View Group (OVG) is the global leader in live experience venue developent, management, premium hospitality services, and 360-degree solutions for a collection of world-class owned venues and a client roster of arenas, convention centers, music festivals, performing arts centers, and cultural institutions. Founded by Tim Leiweke and Irving Azoff in 2015, OVG is the leading developer of major new venues either open or under development across four continents. Oak View Group (OVG) is the global leader in live experience venue development, management, premium hospitality services, and 360-degree solutions for a collection of world-class owned venues and a client roster of arenas, convention centers, music festivals, performing arts centers, and cultural institutions. Founded by Tim Leiweke and Irving Azoff in 2015, OVG is the leading developer of major new venues either open or under development across four continents.  Visit OakViewGroup.com, and follow OVG on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and X. P Parking Any parking-related questions can be directed toward D avid Lewis. Phone Numbers Please click here for a list of our contact information. Premium Seating The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at Florida State University offers a new dimension in business/client relations for Tallahassee. Our 34 Suites and 468 Club Seats are located mid-level and include their own private entrance and private concourse. All this with a vantage point that can put you within 19 rows of the Arena Floor. For questions about pricing and availability, contact the Tucker Center box office at (850) 645-0747. Prohibited Items To help ensure your safety, the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center has strict security measures designed to help all guests have a safe and enjoyable experience while attending an event at the Tucker Center. Your safety is always our first concern. The following items are not permitted at Donald L. Tucker Civic Center Events: Cameras not meeting designated event standards All flags and signs (with or without sticks or poles) Alcohol or illegal drugs Food or beverage from outside of the Tucker Center Coolers or containers, including cans, cups, and bottles Backpacks Artificial noisemakers (whistles, bells, air horns, etc.) Video equipment, tape recorders, cameras with lenses longer than 6" Laser pointers Laptops Pets (except service animals) Skateboards Beach balls or other airborne objects Fireworks Wrapped gifts Additional items may be prohibited at the discretion of law enforcement officers Purchasing Tickets The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center Box Office is open Monday through Friday, 10:00AM to 5:00PM. The Box Office accepts VISA, American Express, MasterCard, Discover and cash for Tucker Center and FSU Basketball events only. If you wish to purchase tickets to an event, you may do so in person at the Tucker Center Box Office or online at www.tuckerciviccenter.com. NO REFUNDS, NO EXCHANGES.  ALL TICKET SALES ARE FINAL. Q Questions, Comments and Complaints Please direct any questions, comments or complaints to TuckerCenter@fsu.edu . R Re-Entry Policy The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center has a no re-entry policy.  If you enter the facility and then leave, you must have an unused ticket to enter the arena again.  For emergencies and special exceptions, please visit Guest Services located behind Section 101 on the main concourse. Refunds or Exchanges There are no ticket refunds or exchanges on any tickets purchased for a concert, family show, or other event at the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. In the event that a show is canceled, refunds will be automatically issued to the original point of purchase. Removal Policy The Tucker Center reserves the right to remove any guest that is deemed disruptive and/or abusive to other guests, staff and players. Reporting Donald L. Tucker Civic Center Issues Please notify any Guest Services staff member or visit the Guest Services desk located behind Section 101 on the main concourse. Restrooms Men’s and Women’s restrooms are located in the four corners of the main concourse. S Schedule of Events Please click here for a full schedule of our events at the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Searches Patrons attending ticketed events will be required to walk through a metal detector prior to entry. Please cooperate with our Security personnel and this will be a smooth process. We hope you have a safe and enjoyable experience while visiting the Donald L. Tucker Civic Center. Security We are committed to providing a safe and enjoyable experience for our guests. If you have any questions, please contact the nearest representative or visit Guest Services located behind section 101 on the main concourse. Service Animals All ADA-approved service animals are allowed within the facility. Guest Services staff will assist with seating. Smoking Policy Smoking is not permitted inside the Tucker Center inclusive of E-Cigarettes. Smoking is permitted outside the south main concourse on the smoking terrace. Social Media Check us out on social media! Facebook Twitter Instagram Spotlight Grille (Restaurant ) Spotlight Grille is located on the South end of the arena on the Club Level. The Grille features a variety of 'Action Stations' including Capital Carvery, Seminole Sauté, Market Fresh Greens, and Sakura Sushi. Food voucher tickets are $12 and can be purchased at the entrance to the Spotlight Grille.  The Grille is open during select events all season. Standing Standing on seats or in aisles is not permitted in the Tucker Center. We ask that you are courteous to everyone around you. Strollers We do not encourage the use of strollers in the Tucker Center. However, we understand the need for them. Strollers that can be folded and placed under your seat are preferred. If they are too large or cannot be folded, guests must leave them in their vehicle or check them in at guest services outside section 101. They can be picked up at the end of the event or whenever you are ready to leave. T Tailgating Tailgating is only permitted for select events. Team Store The Team Store is located on the NW concourse. Athletic merchandise and other fan favorites can be purchased there. Ticket Delivery (Please note: Some events have additional restrictions on purchase and delivery of tickets.) MOBILE TICKET: 1. Open your Ticketmaster app. 2. Sign into your account . 3. Tap My Events and find your order. 4. Tap View Tickets to access your tickets.  We recommend adding your tickets to a digital wallet so that you'll always have your ticket on hand -- even withouth internet connection. 5. Present your tickets to get scanned for entry and you're in! WILL CALL: A government-issued ID which matches the name on the account and the credit card used for the purchase, are required to pick up your tickets.  Please note there are sometimes long lines for Will Call.  You may pick up your tickets at the box office Monday through Friday, 10:00AM-5:00PM .  Please note, some events have additional restrictions on picking up Will Call tickets. Ticketing Information Tickets purchased through phone and Internet are subject to additional service charges. Anyone who exceeds the limit may have any or all of their order cancelled without notice by Ticketmaster at its discretion. This includes orders associated with the same address, billing address, credit card number or other information. Ticket Scalping Florida Law prohibits the reselling of tickets on Tucker Center Property. Ticket Stubs Be prepared to show mobile ticket upon entry. U Umbrellas Umbrellas are permitted in the Tucker Center. They must be closed and placed under your seat. V Video and Audio Equipment Policy Video and audio recording equipment is not permitted in the Tucker Center unless otherwise stated for a specific event. W Weapons No weapons of any kind are permitted in the Tucker Center. This includes law enforcement officers attending an event as a guest. Wheelchairs The Tucker Center does not provide wheelchairs for personal use. Wheelchairs are available for transport only. Please see a Guest Services staff member for assistance. Will Call Will Call is located at the main box office on the NW side of the building and is open Monday through Friday: 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and normally one hour prior to the start of an event on Saturday and Sunday. Please be prepared to present a photo I.D. when picking up tickets. Marketing Coordinator – Donald L Tucker Civic Center – News & Events Close MAIN MENU Home News Academics School of Communication School of Communication Science & Disorders School of Information Events HELPFUL LINKS Skip to content FLORIDA STATE UNIVERSITY Search Search in CCI: CCI Schools & Centers DONATE NOW Welcome to the College of Communication & Information Schools and Colleges College of Communication & Information School of Communication School of Information School of Communication Science & Disorders Centers of Distinction Centers and Labs Garnet & Gold Scholar Society News & Events at College of Communication & Information Home News Academics School of Communication School of Communication Science & Disorders School of Information Events Menu Marketing Coordinator – Donald L Tucker Civic Center Posted by Ebrahim Randeree on May 22, 2019 December 13, 2022 Job ID 2019-4665 Overview This position is based at our Donald L. Tucker Civic Center . The Donald L. Tucker Civic Center at Florida State University is North Florida’s Premier Entertainment & Convention Center featuring a 12,500 seat arena, luxury suites, club seats, over 54,000 sq. ft. of meeting and exhibition space and an arena view restaurant, the Spotlight Grille. It is easy to understand why over a half a million people attend events at the Tucker Civic Center with the varied array of attractions we offer. Consider: a $33.8 million versatile, contemporary complex; excellent facilities; reasonable rates; and a cooperative and efficient staff that knows its business and your needs. You can learn more about our venue here: https://www.tuckerciviccenter.com/ This position will work with the Director of Marketing to market the facilities and events while creating and maintaining relationships with media and promotional partners. The marketing coordinator will assist in advertising, media buying, interactive media, ticketing analysis, promotions, public relations and grassroots efforts for events as assigned. Spectra, an industry leader in sports, entertainment and venue management, is dedicated to recruiting and developing individuals with the skills, experience, desire, and values to contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization.  Together, with our 250+ sports & entertainment venue partners, we transform events into experiences! These experiences create excitement, turn heads, and make memories.  Come Join Us!  You can learn more about Spectra at www.spectraexperiences.com/ Responsibilities Develop and implement marketing plans and strategies for events, including creation of advertising materials, media buying, promotions, grassroots, interactive efforts and public relations for events Negotiate, close, and implement media and promotional agreements for Tucker Center events with promoters and media clients Manage event day activities including but not limited to: pre-event or on-site promotions, meet and greets and media Prepare written letter of agreements including negotiating terms Assist the Director of Marketing to develop, maintain and coordinate event and facility advertising programs, collateral material and opportunities Update and maintain facility’s image when working with customers; this includes but is not limited to: facility website; databases and all social media, additionally serve as liaison for all website related promotions and initiatives Assist Director of Marketing in preparation of monthly corporate marketing reports and participate in monthly conference calls with other Spectra entities Prepare various reports on public relations progress, marketing efforts/results, ticketing analysis, demographics and economic trends, including event recaps Create collateral materials such as print ads, online ads, promotional pieces, posters, schedules, calendars and various ticket brochures from concept to completion Maintain and create detailed media budgets, settlement reconciliations, and recap summaries for facility events Manage day to day digital marketing program, including but not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Website, Venue App, Facility Email Program, SEO, Google Analytics, etc. Coordinate marketing efforts between promoters, artist management and local media Pitch stories, write press releases, create public relations events, generate media hits, implement media drops and build relationships with local media and outlying markets Manage all grassroots efforts including poster & flier distribution, community appearances and overall expansion of marketing campaigns to maximize event awareness and exposure Generate new and creative ideas to attract new events/self-created events and to promote events when booked, including social media and food & beverage promotions Update website, marquee and in-arena address systems (including flyers, posters, TV creative) Manage database and email campaigns Develop new marketing programs and initiatives to maximize ticket sales, such as third party partnerships, new media avenues Participate in the development and implementation of annual marketing goals, objectives, policies and priorities Recruit and assist managing student interns and/or part-time marketing staff and their assignments Perform all other duties as assigned Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Marketing, Public Relations, Communications, Hospitality/Sports Management, Business or a related field Minimum of one (1) year of experience in sales and/or marketing, preferably with a sports facility, convention center, performing arts facility or other multi-purpose public assembly facility Must be a committed, organized user of social media tools, with an understanding of how to drive programs through digital media and website maintenance, manage database marketing to reach new customers and drive increased revenue Accountable and detail-oriented; must be able to juggle many tasks within time constraints Strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills Flexible – must be available to work evenings, weekends and all event days as assigned Microsoft office applications and word processing skills required, as well as database management and graphic design (Adobe Creative Suite) Team player who is a creative and proactive problem solver Ability to travel as required Accountabilities: Increases and maintains the public’s awareness of upcoming events, while promoting the facility; assists in continuously improving marketing/public relations efforts; develops and maintains cooperative, positive relationships with the community, media, and promoters; promotes facility’s reputation as a world-class venue. Intellectual/Social, Physical Demands and Work Environment: The intellectual/social, physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform  the essential functions. Intellectual/Social demands: While performing the essential functions of this job, the employee is continuously asked to multi-task under time limits.  Position requires constant attention to precise details and accuracy of specified standards including: following simple to complex (more than 3 steps) instructions, and concentration which frequently extends beyond 30 minutes at a time. Employees in this role will constantly be in leadership role; this requires directing others either verbally or in writing to complete tasks in prescribed time frame.  This position also requires constant use of interpersonal skills including: ability to direct/motivate/inform staff and foster collaboration, being able to recognize and resolve conflicts, being able to openly communicate in writing and verbally with clients. Physical demands: While performing the essential functions of the job, the employee constantly operates a computer and other office devices such telephones, copy machines, fax machines, etc; occasionally moves about inside the office to access storage areas, cabinets and office machinery; constantly moves about the arena and event sites before, during and after events to service clients and supervise staff; constantly communicates via telephone, email and in-person with others to exchange accurate information. Work environment: The essential functions of this position are normally performed indoors and occasionally outdoors in the weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment can be moderate to loud during events, depending on the employee’s physical location in the facility, and minimal during non-event times. the City of Tallahassee, Leon County, the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, Community Foundation of North Florida, Knight Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, and the Tallahassee Community Redevelopment Agency. COCA, the Council on Culture & Arts, is a non-profit organization that serves as the facilitator and voice for the arts and cultural industry in Florida's capital area. COCA provides information and promotes the arts and culture to both citizens and visitors. ABOUT US DIRECTORIES CLASSIFIEDS PARTNERS CONTACT US 114 S DUVAL STREET TALLAHASSEE, FL 32301 LOCAL NUMBER: (850) 224-2500 EMAIL: info@tallahasseearts.org © Copyright 2025 - Council on Culture & Arts | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Powered by ARTSOPOLIS The COCA office currently has adjusted office hours to 1 PM – 5 PM to accommodate pickup for Winterfest. These hours will be adjusted from Tuesday, February 11, through Friday, February 28 . Regular office hours will return on Monday, March 3. For questions, feel free to contact staff via phone or email. In addition, access to Railroad Avenue between Gaines Street & FAMU Way is down to one lane heading south. For access to the COCA office, please take Gaines Street as currently, the COCA office is not accessible off of FAMU Way.
